***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
Standard:
    * IPA(key): /ki/
Dialectal:
    * IPA(key): /ke/
**** Etymology 1[edit] ****
Borrowed from Classical_Persian که‎ (ki). Compare Gujarati કે (ke), Marathi की
(kī), Punjabi ਕਿ (ki).
*** Conjunction[edit] ***
कि • (ki) (Urdu spelling کہ‎)
   1. that
            मुझे मालूम नहीं था कि तुम्हें मराठी आती है।
                  mujhe mālūm nahī̃ thā ki tumhẽ marāṭhī ātī hai.
                  I didn't know that you speak Marathi
                  (literally, “It wasn't known to me that Marathi comes to
                  you.”)

    * McGregor,_Ronald_Stuart (1993), “कि”, inThe Oxford Hindi-English

    * Platts,_John_T. (1884), “कि”, inA dictionary of Urdu, classical Hindi,
      and English, London: W. H. Allen & Co.
    * “कि”, inCollins Gem Hindi-English Dictionary, Collins, 2011, →ISBN
    * Dāsa,_Śyāmasundara (1965–1975), “कि”, inHindī_Śabdasāgara [lit. Sea of
      Hindi words](in Hindi), Kashi [Varanasi]: Nagari Pracarini Sabha
    * Turner,_Ralph_Lilley (1969–1985), “ki”, inA Comparative Dictionary of the
      Indo-Aryan Languages, London: Oxford University Press

      [Learners' Hindi-English Dictionary], Delhi: Rajpal & Sons.
**** Etymology 2[edit] ****
See क्या (kyā, “what”).
*** Particle[edit] ***
कि • (ki) (Urdu spelling کہ‎)
   1. or
            Synonyms: या (yā), अथवा (athvā)
** Usage notes[edit] **
Usually used as कि … कि … (ki … ki …, “… or …”).
***** Nepali[edit] *****
**** Conjunction[edit] ****
कि • (ki)
   1. or
***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [ki]
**** Noun[edit] ****
कि • (ki) ? (Newa Spelling 𑐎𑐶)
   1. grain
